confession.seduction_date: 4 months after second visit (approximately 3-4 years before arrest)
confession.seduction_context: Appeared when she was ill in bed after her husband nearly drowned in millstream. First appeared twice without intercourse, third time had sexual relations with her.
sabbat_locations: côte d'Arry (on E bank of Moselle)
sabbat_activities: rich caused hail to fall around Arnaville and Woysaige
attempted to damage grain in flower
snow fell mainly on woods instead

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied sabbat attendance, described visitations by spirit but denied intercourse

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet
timeline.details: Second interrogation - confessed to intercourse with devil, receiving powders, causing harms, attending sabbat 5 times

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet
timeline.details: Rémy asks for witnesses to be heard to discover additional malefices; Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet
timeline.details: Third interrogation - confirmed earlier confessions; Collignon Chandelot gave evidence

timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet

timeline.subject: Bonne Bricholet

notable_quotes.context: When suggested she might receive sentence less than death since she had killed no-one

economic_context.details: Dispute over a small house with Jean Huielle. Tax collection by Collignon Chandelot requiring surety (basin, then frying pan). Sale of bread to pay taxes mentioned. Lost calf from cow sale to Martin Mathiot.

harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured him (method not specified, likely white grease or yellow powder)

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a detailed case with full confession obtained without torture. Notable for: (1) mother's prior arrest and suicide in prison; (2) progression from denial to detailed confession between first and second interrogation; (3) detailed account of sabbat activities including class conflict (rich vs poor) over weather damage; (4) healing as well as harming; (5) resigned attitude - preferred death to continued life. The formal sentence carelessly claimed she caused deaths when confession only mentioned illnesses and healing. Only one witness (Collignon Chandelot) testified, corroborating her confession about his leg trouble.
